venue.name: Rabb Auditorium at Boston Public Library in Copley Square

item.description:
massmouth, inc. presents: First Annual Boston Storytelling Festival, April 21st, 2012 at the Boston Public Library

Mark your Calendars!  On April 21st at the Boston Public Library, from 10am-4:30pm storytellers from massmouth,inc. will make you laugh, sing and think as they present the art of storytelling through folk and fairy tales, songs, story slams and personal narrative.

Storytelling has been entertaining human beings since time immemorial, but the art form hasn’t really been getting the kind of attention it deserves. And Boston based  massmouth, inc. has been changing that. Since 2008, massmouth,inc., hosts of the first story slam in Boston (at Kennedy's Pub in OCT 2009 ) have held 100s of live events, taught 1000s of people including 1000s of high school students to tell their stories and have hosted a robust online presence that includes audio, video and social media sites. 

The Boston Storytelling Festival intends to be an annual event and features a variety of storytelling experiences -- from workshops, to traditional and contemporary storytelling, slams: the works – in an effort to make storytelling truly accessible.

 

FREE workshops will be held all day on how to tell traditional or personal stories like, “From Page to Stage” and, “How to tell a kick-butt 5 minute story” .  Rabb  Lecture Hall will host ongoing concerts throughout the day, that festival- goers will be encouraged to drop in on as they please. And storytellers will be street performers outside at the Copley Sq entrance.

A score of acclaimed storytellers have signed on to perform, including several award-winning storytellers from massmouth slams.  A few of the traditional storytellers include: Judith Black, Doria Hughes, Norah Dooley, Andrea Lovett, Ben Cunningham**, Paula Junn, Jo Radner, Cindy Rivka Marshall, Katie Green and ToRena Webb Thomas.

Storytellers “for the 21st century” include Laura Packer, Scott Schultz, Ben Cunningham**, Robin Maxfield, ToRena Webb Thomas, Norah Dooley, Andrea Lovett, Michael Anderson*, Jackson Anderson, Katie Liesener ***, Farrah Haidar *** will be joined by some of the winners from our season III finale on April 11th 2012 at Coolidge Corner Theater.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

*Finalist, big mouthoff season 1

**1st place award winner, big mouthoff Season 2

*** 2nd place award winner, Season 2

Plus!  Exclusive performances by our represent

ative winners of The BigMouthOff, 2012! (Our third season running! )


"Storytelling is our "birthright" art.  We aim to reacquaint people with their own creativity and imaginations. In doing so, we bring people together in meaningful and rewarding connection." - Norah Dooley, co-founder and Executive Director

Best of all?  Honoring our commitment to bring storytelling to the widest audience possible,  massmouth,inc. presents this entire event FREE and open to the public.  In order to secure a place in your workshop(s) of choice, pre-registration is strongly recommended but not required.

We hope to see you on the 21st, at what we hope will become an annual celebration of the art of storytelling in its many forms in the city of Boston!

This program is sponsored in part by the Boston Cultural Council, a local agency, as administered by the Massachusetts Cultural Council, a state agency.

COMING SOON:  http://massmouth.eventbrite.com/ for free registration to the workshops, check back in a day or so,
